label: 貫高
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: The assessed value of a landholding for tax purposes in terms of cash; this amount was the way of expressing the size of the holding. Used nationally by the late medieval period. Sengoku daimyō used kandaka figures to estimate the amount of military service due from their vassals. See kokudaka.　[石高]
